member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Extensions.DesignOnlyResourceDictionary
member.summary: The design only resource dictionary is a specialized resource dictionary that references content only in design mode.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Extensions.DesignOnlyResourceDictionary.IsInDesignMode
member.summary: return true if in design mode

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Extensions.DesignOnlyResourceDictionary.Source
member.summary: This dictionary only sets the URI when the VS XAML designer is active. During runtime the resource dictionary is empty. Here is an example of a URI: Source="pack://application:,,,/ArcGIS.Desktop.Framework;component\Themes\Default.xaml" Consequently this property returns source (URI) only in design mode and hence resolves the designer's requirements for resources During runtime WPF gets the resource from Pro's framework, hence the resource is set the properly theme.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MappingExtensions.CreateTemplate(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Layer,System.String,System.String,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Attributes.Inspector,System.String,System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a new template using the specified definition. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: the layer the new template is to be added to.
the template name.
Optional description of the template.
An object containing default template values.
Optional, If not provided will use the default tool for the layer type. The defaultTool can be specified using daml-id.
Optional. A set of tags.
Optional list of tools to not allow for this template. Tool filters can be specified using daml-id.
member.exception: the Template name cannot be empty. And the template name must be unique.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MappingExtensions.CreatePresetTemplate(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Layer,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Layer,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64}},ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.MapPoint)
member.summary: Creates a new preset template from the specified set of features.
member.param: the layer the new template is to be added to.
the template name.
The features to include in the preset
An optional point to use as the point where the preset is placed. If null is provided the centroid of the features will be used.
member.returns: A task yielding the newly created template. Null if it cannot be created.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MappingExtensions.AutoGenerateTemplates(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapMember,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generate feature templates for a layer or standalone-table. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run
member.param: (Optional) Remove existing templates and regenerate. (default value = false)
member.returns: Boolean. True if templates were genenerated.
member.remarks: This method attempts to generate feature templates on a layer or standalone-table. If flag is true, the templates are generated from the renderer. When false the templates are not regenerated unless forcecreate is specified.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MappingExtensions.CreateGroupTemplateDefinition(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.BasicFeatureLayer,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary:
Creates a new group template object using the specified definition. Adds the base template specified to the group template as the base part. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run. Use this method in conjunction with calls to
for each component part. Once the group template is fully defined, use to add the template to the template manager.
member.remarks: Group templates are not supported for multipoint, multipatch, annotation or dimension layers.
member.param: the layer to use as the base.
the template name for the new group template.
the name of the template used as the base.
Optional description of the template.
Optional. A set of tags.
member.exception: The layer must exist and the base template name must exist on the layer. Group template name must not be empty and be unique.
This method must be called on the Main CIM Thread. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.returns: the newly created group template object. Null if it cannot be created.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MappingExtensions.AddComponentTemplate(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroupEditingTemplate,ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Layer,System.String,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Adds a component part to the group template. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: the group template the component template is to be added to.
the layer for the component part.
the name of the template used as the component part.
the builder method for the component part.
options for the component part.
member.exception: the layer must exist and the template name must exist on the layer.
This method must be called on the Main CIM Thread. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.returns: the updated group template object.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MappingExtensions.AddOverlayAsync(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapView,ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map view.
member.param: The view to add the overlay.
The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MappingExtensions.AddOverlayAsync(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapView,ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference,System.Double)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map view.
member.param: The view to add the overlay.
The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
Map reference scale or -1
member.remarks: When the referenceScale is not equal to -1, the overlay will be created in real world units relative to the provided map reference scale (referenceScale). Otherwise, the overlay will be created in units of points. This is only supported in 2D.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode
member.summary: Specifies different modes for the sketch to be in to modify the current sketch geometry.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Line
member.summary: Adds new line segments to the end of the sketch geometry.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Arc
member.summary: Adds new circular arc segments to the end of the sketch geometry.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.EndPointArc
member.summary: Adds new circular arc segments to the end of the sketch geometry.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.TangentArc
member.summary: Adds new circular arc segments to the end of the sketch geometry, tangent to the last segment.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Bezier
member.summary: Adds new bezier curve segments to the end of the sketch geometry.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Trace
member.summary: Adds a new traced pat to the end of the sketch geometry.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.RightLine
member.summary: Adds a new segment to the end of the sketch geometry, constrained to right angles.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Midpoint
member.summary: Adds a new segment to the sketch geometry at the midpoint between two points.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Stream
member.summary: Adds a new path of streamed vertices to the end of the sketch geometry.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Move
member.summary: Moves the sketch geometry

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Rotate
member.summary: Rotates the sketch geometry

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Scale
member.summary: Scales the sketch geometry

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.VertexMove
member.summary: Modifies the location of vertices of the sketch geometry.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.VertexInsert
member.summary: Splits segments of the sketch geometry adding vertices.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.VertexDelete
member.summary: Deletes vertices of the sketch.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.DistanceDistance
member.summary: Adds a new vertex to the sketch geometry at the intersection of two distances from two other points.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.Intersection
member.summary: Adds a new vertex at the implied intersection of two segments.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.DirectionDistance
member.summary: Adds a new vertex at the intersection of a direction from one point and a distance from another point.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.SketchMode.DirectionDirection
member.summary: Adds a new vertex at the intersection of two directions from two other points.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool
member.summary: Represents a tool command used to perform interactive operations on a .

remarks.para: This base class can be used to create tools to interactively identify and select features in the view or to create custom construction and editing tools. It provides virtual methods that can be overridden to perform actions when keyboard and mouse events occur in the map view, such as and . When overriding mouse and keyboard virtual methods if you need to execute any asynchronous code first set the handled property on the event arguments to true, override the corresponding "Handle...Async" method, and add your asynchronous code.

By setting the property to true, the tool will create a sketch in the map view with a left mouse click. Use the property to set the geometry type of the sketch and use the property to specify whether the sketch geometry is in screen or map coordinates. Override to add behavior to the tool when the sketch is finished.

code.title: Custom Identify
code.description: Create a tool that allows you to sketch in the view and return the features that intersect the sketch.

code.title: Get Map Coordinates
code.description: Create a tool that allows you to click in the view and return the point in map coordinates that was clicked.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for MapTool.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.UpdateCursor
member.summary: Occurs when a cursor is set on this tool. Forward the cursor to the inner tool.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.ActiveMapView
member.summary: Gets the active .

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.IsSketchTool
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the MapTool's default behavior of a left click should be to create a sketch.
member.remarks: When setting this property to true, set the and properties which configure the sketch geometry. Override the virtual method to get the geometry created from the sketch. This geometry can be used to create a selection, identify features, and create or modify features.

code.title: Custom Identify
code.description: Create a tool that allows you to sketch in the view and return the features that intersect the sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.SketchOutputMode
member.summary: Gets or sets if the sketch geometry should be created using map or screen coordinates.
member.remarks: Set to true for this property to take effect. When performing an interactive selection or identify using the or method, it's important to note that only geometries in screen coordinates are supported in 3D. In 2D, both map and screen geometries are supported.

code.title: Custom Identify
code.description: Create a tool that allows you to sketch in the view and return the features that intersect the sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.SketchType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type or shape of the geometry to be created by the sketch.
member.remarks: Set to true for this property to take effect.

code.title: Custom Identify
code.description: Create a tool that allows you to sketch in the view and return the features that intersect the sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.ContextMenuID
member.summary: Gets or sets the DAML ID of the context menu for the tool.
member.remarks: By default this will be null and will display the default context menu for the tool. To display no context menu set the value to an empty string or handle the event for the right mouse button.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.CompleteSketchOnMouseUp
member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse up behavior for Rectangle/Circle/Ellipse/Freehand sketches.
member.remarks: Default value of null uses user setting in Editor properties page, true finishes a sketch on mouse up, false requires two clicks to finish sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.ControlID
member.summary: Gets or sets the DAML ID of the embeddable control to show in the dock pane when the tool is active.
member.remarks: In some cases you may need to provide a dock pane to configure the behavior of the tool while in use similar to many of the editing tools. This property allows you to define a Embeddable Control to display within a dock pane while to the tool is active. If you close the dock pane the tool will be deactivated and if you activate a different tool the dock pane will close. You can get a reference to the Embeddable Control using the property.

code.title: Embeddable Control
code.description: Set the embeddable control for a MapTool.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.KeepControlOpenAfterDeactivation
member.summary: Optional property to allow tool's embeddable control to remain open after the tool is deactivated.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.OverlayControlID
member.summary: Gets or sets the DAML ID of the embeddable control to show on the map view when the tool is active.
member.remarks: In some cases you may need to provide a control that displays on top of the map view to configure the behavior of the tool while in use similar to the measure tool. This property allows you to define a Embeddable Control to display on top of the map view while to the tool is active. When you activate a different tool the overlay control will be removed. You can get a reference to the Embeddable Control using the property.

code.title: Overlay Embeddable Control
code.description: Set the overlay embeddable control for a MapTool.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.OverlayControlLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the embeddable control on the map view.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.OverlayControlPositionRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the embeddable control on the map view as a ratio.

members.member:
Gets or sets the DAML ID of the context menu shown when modifying a segment.
By default this will be null and will display the default segment context menu for the tool.

Gets or sets the DAML ID of the toolbar to display for the tool.
By default this will be null and will display the default context toolbar for the tool.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.UseSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the active map view must have a selection to perform a sketch. If the map doesn't have a selection the tool will behave as the selection tool until you create a new selection.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.UseSnapping
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use snapping to precisely sketch on the active map view. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.CurrentTemplate
member.summary: Gets the active editing template being used by the tool.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.UsesCurrentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the sketch is for creating a feature and should use the CurrentTemplate.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.IsWYSIWYG
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the sketch shows a symbol.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.GeomIsSimpleAsFeature
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the geometry constructed from a finished sketch should be simplified prior to being returned to . The default value is true.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.SketchSymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets the symbol to use for the sketch. This is only supported when creating a sketch in map coordinates.

code.title: Set Sketch Symbol
code.description: Change the default symbol used while sketching.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.EmbeddableControl
member.summary: Gets the EmbeddableControl created for the tool. This is the control set by the property.
member.remarks: In some cases you may need to provide a dock pane to configure the behavior of the tool while in use similar to many of the editing tools. This property returns the instance of the EmbeddableControl set by the . property. If you close the dock pane the tool will be deactivated and if you activate a different tool the dock pane will close.

code.title: Embeddable Control
code.description: Set the embeddable control for a MapTool.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.OverlayEmbeddableControl
member.summary: Gets the EmbeddableControl created for the tool to be shown on the map view. This is control set by the property.
member.remarks: In some cases you may need to provide a control that displays on top of the map view to configure the behavior of the tool while in use similar to the measure tool. This property returns the instance of the overlay EmbeddableControl set by the . property. When you activate a different tool the overlay control will be removed.

code.title: Overlay Embeddable Control
code.description: Set the overlay embeddable control for a MapTool.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.OverlayControlCanResize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the embeddable control on the map view can be resized.

member.summary: Occurs when a sketch is finished.
member.param: The geometry of the sketch.
member.returns: True if the sketch complete event was handled.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.AddOverlayAsync(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map view.
member.remarks: When the tool is deactivated all overlay graphics will be removed.
member.param: The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapTool.AddOverlayAsync(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference,System.Double)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map view.
member.remarks: When the tool is deactivated all overlay graphics will be removed.
member.param: The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
Map reference scale or -1
member.remarks: When the referenceScale is not equal to -1, the overlay will be created in real world units relative to the provided map reference scale (referenceScale). Otherwise, the overlay will be created in units of points. This is only supported in 2D.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

The symbol to use for the update.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Core.Data.Extensions.ArcGISCoreDataExtensions
member.summary: This convenience API provides commonly-used geodatabase extension methods for the ArcGIS.Core.Data API.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Core.Data.Extensions.ArcGISCoreDataExtensions.EvaluateInEditOperation(ArcGIS.Core.Data.AttributeRuleManager,ArcGIS.Core.Data.AttributeRuleEvaluationDescription)
member.summary: Evaluates all the applicable tables and feature classes in the geodatabase associated with using the operation(s) specified by in the validation service. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: The instance to manage attribute rules on behalf of a geodatabase.
The which describes the details of the evaluate operation.
member.returns: An that describes the result of the operation(s).

ul.li: This routine creates its own edit operation, and can therefore not be called within an existing transaction.
If this operation is successful, it will create an edit operation on the Pro undo/redo stack, invalidate the affected layers and cause the to redraw. When writing a CoreHost application, use .

exception.para: Cannot find a layer in the active map that connects to the same geodatabase as that of the Attribute Rule Manager.
A validation service is not supported or enabled for this geodatabase.
If the geodatabase is opened from the Default version and is specified for the VersionEvaluationScope argument in .

member.exception: This method must be called on the Main CIM Thread. Use QueuedTask.Run.
A geodatabase-related exception has occurred.

member.summary: Updates the validation error system tables specified by . This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: The instance to manage attribute rules on behalf of a geodatabase.
A of one or more objects.

ul.li: This routine creates its own edit operation, and can therefore not be called within an existing transaction.
If this operation is successful, it will create an edit operation on the Pro undo/redo stack, invalidate the affected layers and cause the to redraw. When writing a CoreHost application, use .

exception.para: Cannot find a layer in the active map that connects to the same geodatabase as that of the Attribute Rule Manager.
A validation service is not supported or enabled for this geodatabase.

member.exception: is null or empty.
This method must be called on the Main CIM Thread. Use QueuedTask.Run.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.Extensions.UtilityNetworkExtensions
member.summary: This convenience API provides commonly-used UtilityNetwork-related extension methods for the ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork API.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.Extensions.UtilityNetworkExtensions.ValidateNetworkTopologyInEditOperation(ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.UtilityNetwork)
member.summary: Validates the utility network topology in an edit operation. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: The instance whose network topology is to be validated.
member.returns: A that describes the result of the operation.

ul.li: This routine creates its own edit operation, and can therefore not be called within an existing transaction.
If this operation is successful, it will create an edit operation on the Pro undo/redo stack, invalidate the affected layers and cause the to redraw. When writing a CoreHost application, use .
For services-based UtilityNetwork, this method defaults to . Note that this C# routine is still synchronous; the current thread will block until the routine completes.

member.exception: This method must be called on the Main CIM Thread. Use QueuedTask.Run.
A geodatabase-related exception has occurred.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.Extensions.UtilityNetworkExtensions.ValidateNetworkTopologyInEditOperation(ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.UtilityNetwork,ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry)
member.summary: Validates the utility network topology in an edit operation. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: The instance whose network topology to validate.
The extent of the area to be validating. If this parameter is missing or null, the entire extent of the utility network is used.
member.returns: A that describes the result of the operation.

member.exception: This method must be called on the Main CIM Thread. Use QueuedTask.Run.

The extent of the area to be validating. If this parameter is missing or null, the entire extent of the utility network is used.
Specifies which implementation of the service endpoint to call. This parameter is ignored for non-services based utility networks.
member.returns: A that describes the result of the operation.

ul.li: This routine creates its own edit operation, and can therefore not be called within an existing transaction.
If this operation is successful, it will create an edit operation on the Pro undo/redo stack, invalidate the affected layers and cause the to redraw. When writing a CoreHost application, use .
Note that regardless of the used, this C# routine is still synchronous; the current thread will block until the routine completes.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.Extensions.UtilityNetworkExtensions.EnableControllerInEditOperation(ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.SubnetworkManager,ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.Tier,ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.Element,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enables a feature corresponding to to be a and adds it to an existing corresponding to . If the specified subnetwork does not exist, a new one will be created. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.

ul.li: This routine creates its own edit operation, and can therefore not be called within an existing transaction.
If this operation is successful, it will create an edit operation on the Pro undo/redo stack, invalidate the affected layers and cause the to redraw. When writing a CoreHost application, use .

member.param: The instance used to add a controller to an existing or newly-created subnetwork.
The to which the is created.
Corresponds to the feature to be enabled as a . This must specify a terminal, and this terminal must be specified as a Controller Terminal in the terminal definition.
Name of the subnetwork.
Name of the subnetwork controller.
A description for the subnetwork controller.
Additional notes for the subnetwork controller.
member.returns: The newly-created or modified subnetwork.
member.remarks: If this operation is successful, it will invalidate the affected layers and cause the to redraw.
member.exception: This method must be called on the Main CIM Thread. Use QueuedTask.Run.
A geodatabase-related exception has occurred.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.Extensions.UtilityNetworkExtensions.DisableControllerInEditOperation(ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.SubnetworkManager,ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.Element)
member.summary: Disables a feature corresponding to from being a . This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.

ul.li: This routine generates its own editing transaction and therefore cannot be wrapped inside a separate transaction.
If this operation is successful, it will create an edit operation on the Pro undo/redo stack, invalidate the affected layers and cause the to redraw. When writing a CoreHost application, use .
If all subnetwork controllers are deleted from a subnetwork, the subnetwork moves to the state.

member.param: The instance used to disable a controller.
Corresponds to the feature to be disabled as a .

remarks.para: If this operation is successful, it will invalidate the affected layers and cause the to redraw.
If all subnetwork controllers are deleted from a subnetwork, the subnetwork moves to the state.

member.exception: This method must be called on the Main CIM Thread. Use QueuedTask.Run.
A geodatabase-related exception has occurred.
